intro: Endodesmia calophylloides, commonly known as the broad-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, elliptical leaves that are typically clustered in groups of three at the ends of its twigs. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing food for wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of forested areas.
